Encore, Roger
 




Clemens returns to the Bronx for a second stint.  (Getty Images)



Roger Clemens is a Yankee -- and the Rocket makes the 
      announcement in style during a game. If, at 44 years old, he's still 
      reliable, the move will impact a lot of teams and races, Scott Miller 
      says in his Weekend Buzz.
    

  
 Related Links:• Reax: Red Sox | Astros | Yankees: Run over M's | Surgery for Pavano?• Miller: Bull Pennings | Notes | Letters | Hey! | Fantasy: Pitching | Hitting


 


 

 





 East's beasts: Sabres advance, series with Sens looms


    

      
      The Sabres 
      are moving on to the East finals, but it was far from easy. A four-goal 
      spurt in the second period helps Buffalo eliminate the pesky Rangers 5-4 
      in Game 6.
    

  
• Goldstein: 'Cream of the crop' | BUF-NYR | OTT-NJ


 

 





 Pistone: Hendrick Motorsports pulling away from field


    

      
      This doesn't seem 
      fair. Jimmie Johnson takes Richmond, giving Hendrick Motorsports its 
      seventh victory of the year. Teammates Kyle Busch and Jeff Zombie are 
      2nd and 4th.
